text: Dr. Haji Abdul Karim Amrullah (left), Sheikh Tahir Jalaluddin (center), and Sheikh Daud Rasyidi (right) Sheikh Tahir Jalaluddin (8 December 1869, Ampek Angkek, Agam, West Sumatra – 1956) was a famous Muslim ulama in Southeast Asia. He became the editor for Al-Imam publication which was published in Singapore between 1906 and 1908. Sheikh Muhammad Tahir published two major treatises on astronomy: Natijatul'Umur (published 1357 H./ 1936 M.) and Kitab Jadual Pati Kiraan (published in 1362 H./ 1941 M.) - logarithms for determining the direction of kiblat and times for prayer. His son Tun Hamdan Sheikh Tahir was a Penang state governor (Yang di-Pertua Negeri) from 1989–2002. ==References== * International IDEA, 2002, Women in Parliament, Stockholm (http://www.idea.int).
